network

Class NetworkEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.NetworkEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class NetworkEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Network Events are used for transferring data through the socket input/output streams. Network Events can be of various types that hold different types of data therefore the EventType must be checked before calling any of the getters as they will be null if the type is incorrect.
    Author:
    Matt Byers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Server Event, that tells the client to move this user on their local copy of Player, in the given direction.

      User events of this type don't require any extra parameters, therefore need to be given a specific type.

      User event of varying type, stores and index and a container.

      NetworkEvent(java.lang.String user, NetworkEvent.EventType type, Item item, Container container)
      User event of varying type, can be used for adding items to containers.

      Creates a network event of the type MESSAGE.

                    Item item)

        Parameters:
        user - - The user to update.
        type - - The type of NetworkEvent.
        item - - The item to be stored.

      • NetworkEvent

        public NetworkEvent(java.lang.String user,
                    NetworkEvent.EventType type,
                    int index1,
                    int index2)

        Parameters:
        user - - The user to update.
        type - - The type of NetworkEvent.
        index1 - - Start index.
        index2 - - End index.

      • NetworkEvent

        public NetworkEvent(java.lang.String user,

        container - - The container itself.

      • NetworkEvent

        public NetworkEvent(java.lang.String user,
                    NetworkEvent.EventType type,
                    int index,
                    Container container)
        User event of varying type, stores and index and a container. Can be used for removing items from a container.
        Parameters:
        user - - The user who created the event
        type - - The type of NetworkEvent
        index - - The index.
        container - - The container to be edited.

      • NetworkEvent

        Parameters:

        type - - The type of NetworkEvent
        item - - The item.
        container - - The container to be modified.
